column4: is there any way to get to grub.lst when you boot up and get /bin/sh: can't access tty; job control turned off
other than a livecd ?
other than using a livecd, is there any way to get to grub.lst when you boot up and get /bin/sh: can't access tty; job control turned off
um dunno, are you implying you're trying to fix the 'job control' problem?  if so how?
yes, i am implying that. i believe it is a problem with grub trying to mount the wrong partition.
but i have no access to /boot when it starts with this no job control nonsense

i would say it's a much deeper problem as it has stumped many a perosn here and nobody knows how to fix it.  i just wondered as we are desperate for solutions on the job control tty thing.  doesn't it open up a mini shell at that stage?
yea. something like that
its some initramfs shell
busybox?
it was just booting fine yesterday, i'm pretty certain it has to do with grub
ahh ok.  well i think it's in some single user mode,  did you try mounting partitions?
ctrl-alt-F1 gives me mount: mounting /dev/hdc1 on /root failed: invalid argument
what about by specifiying fs type?  it might be more picky in that mode
is there any way to access /boot/grub/grub.lst from initramfs
umm no im afraid now
afraid not **
i dont know, if mount doesnt work then no there isn't a way.  unless 'grub' works in which case you could if there is some text editro in grub.
why dont you modify the gurb cmd line on bootup?
how do i do that
by the way yes it says busybox v1.1.3 built-in shell
bahh i dont know, i dont think grub has a text editor i was just letting my mind run wild there
well with busybox you should be able to mount stuff.  if it has your HD controller modules loaded and stuff
